messages.msgSnippet: I feel like I won the lottery. I m one of the lucky 90!
messages.messageBody: I feel like I won the lottery. I'm one of the lucky 90!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just Add Light subscriptions
messages.msgSnippet: It’s back this morning!  I got mine my e-mail. Just Add Light and Stir	1,540 It’s back this morning! I got mine my e-mail. Just Add Light and Stir 1,540
messages.messageBody:
It’s back this morning!  I got mine my e-mail.   

Just Add Light and Stir 1,540

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just Add Light subscriptions
messages.msgSnippet: Yay, I was one of the lucky ones too! If you save a CSV copy of your list then you can take it anywhere, but the only other free services I know of is
messages.messageBody:
Yay, I was one of the lucky ones too!

If you save a CSV copy of your list then you can take it anywhere, but the only other free services I know of is Mailchimp, (free until 2,000 subscribers), and Mailer Lite (free up to 1,000).  

This article seemed relevant and had instructions on how to save a CSV copy of the email addresses: http://btr.michaelkwan.com/2012/09/25/how-to-recover-your-lost-feedburner-email-subscribers/

I hope you can get it back and working again!  I really love those and look for them each day.

-Kathryn 


On Mon, Feb 20, 2017 at 9:09 PM, Bernadette Lynn bernadette.lynn@... [AlwaysLearning] <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
 

On reading this I realised that I haven't seen it for a while. So I followed your link and clicked on the subscribe button to see if I was still subscribed, and got a message saying 'welcome back!' with my email address.


It obviously knows I was subscribed at some point, but I don't remember when I stopped getting the emails.



Bernadette.

On 20 February 2017 at 10:37, Sandra Dodd Sandra@... [AlwaysLearning] <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups. com> wrote:
I have a mystery.  I didn’t receive my own Just Add Light and Stir mailing for the past two nights.  (I went to bed early and am up at 3:30 a.m. in Albuquerque; unnatural, but just in case anyone noticed the time.)

I went to see what it might be, and Feedburner (a google function I use to let people subscribe to the blog by mail) shows 90 subscribers.  I thought there should be 1500.

Looking at the stats there, it says February 18, subscribers:  1,654
February 19, subscribers 90

Maybe this is a glitch feedburner will fix on their own.  With it being a Monday-off holiday in the U.S. maybe it won’t be seen or dealt with until Tuesday.   But I thought just maybe someone here would know something, or at least I could let some subscribers know of the problem.

My next largest subscription feed is to the unschooling site news
http://sandradodd.com/aboutuns chooling
which has 193 subscribers and had 191 the day before, so that one isn’t messed up, seems.

I don’t think re-subscribing is necessary; I think it will be restored, but if anyone wants to see the two that didn’t go out, here:

http://justaddlightandstir.blo gspot.com

I hope this is the worst thing that happens this week, to any of us! :-)

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just Add Light subscriptions
messages.msgSnippet: I must be one of the lucky few, with Alex - as i m still getting mine (up to yesterday, at least!) Jo I have a mystery.  I didnÆt receive my own Just Add
messages.messageBody:
I must be one of the lucky few, with Alex - as i'm still getting mine (up to yesterday, at least!)

Jo

I have a mystery.  I didn’t receive my own Just Add Light and Stir mailing for the past two nights.  (I went to bed early and am up at 3:30 a.m. in Albuquerque; unnatural, but just in case anyone noticed the time.)

I went to see what it might be, and Feedburner (a google function I use to let people subscribe to the blog by mail) shows 90 subscribers.  I thought there should be 1500.  

Looking at the stats there, it says February 18, subscribers:  1,654
February 19, subscribers 90

Maybe this is a glitch feedburner will fix on their own.  With it being a Monday-off holiday in the U.S. maybe it won’t be seen or dealt with until Tuesday.   But I thought just maybe someone here would know something, or at least I could let some subscribers know of the problem.

My next largest subscription feed is to the unschooling site news
http://sandradodd.com/aboutunschooling
which has 193 subscribers and had 191 the day before, so that one isn’t messed up, seems.

I don’t think re-subscribing is necessary; I think it will be restored, but if anyone wants to see the two that didn’t go out, here:

http://justaddlightandstir.blogspot.com

I hope this is the worst thing that happens this week, to any of us! :-)

Sandra

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Just Add Light subscriptions
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I got mine yesterday for sure!-=- Oooh!  One of the lucky 90. So others missed seeing your cat watching TV. :-) I found an address to write to feedburner.
messages.messageBody:
-=-I got mine yesterday for sure!-=-

Oooh! One of the lucky 90.
So others missed seeing your cat watching TV. :-)

I found an address to write to feedburner. It might not help, but will make me feel better so I can go to sleep happier. :-)

Sandra

messages.subject: Just Add Light subscriptions
messages.msgSnippet: I have a mystery.  I didn’t receive my own Just Add Light and Stir mailing for the past two nights.  (I went to bed early and am up at 3:30 a.m. in
messages.messageBody:
I have a mystery. I didn’t receive my own Just Add Light and Stir mailing for the past two nights. (I went to bed early and am up at 3:30 a.m. in Albuquerque; unnatural, but just in case anyone noticed the time.)

I went to see what it might be, and Feedburner (a google function I use to let people subscribe to the blog by mail) shows 90 subscribers. I thought there should be 1500.

Looking at the stats there, it says February 18, subscribers: 1,654
February 19, subscribers 90

Maybe this is a glitch feedburner will fix on their own. With it being a Monday-off holiday in the U.S. maybe it won’t be seen or dealt with until Tuesday. But I thought just maybe someone here would know something, or at least I could let some subscribers know of the problem.

My next largest subscription feed is to the unschooling site news
http://sandradodd.com/aboutunschooling
which has 193 subscribers and had 191 the day before, so that one isn’t messed up, seems.

I don’t think re-subscribing is necessary; I think it will be restored, but if anyone wants to see the two that didn’t go out, here:

http://justaddlightandstir.blogspot.com

I hope this is the worst thing that happens this week, to any of us! :-)

Sandra
